title: Explainable Visual Analytics with LLM-Based Natural Language Interfaces
description: Natural language interfaces for visual analytics often lack transparency, making it difficult for users to understand how the system generates visualizations and insights. This opacity can lead to mistrust and reduced effectiveness in data analysis.
motivation: XNLI (Explaining and Diagnosing NLI-Based Visual Data Analysis) provides explanations but focuses on diagnosing issues rather than enhancing transparency throughout the process. By integrating explainable AI techniques with LLMs, we can create a more transparent visual analytics system that helps users understand the underlying processes and trust the generated insights.
questions: How can we design LLM-based natural language interfaces for visual analytics to enhance transparency and explainability in generating visualizations?
What are the most effective methods for integrating explanatory features within natural language interfaces to improve user trust and understanding of data insights?
To what extent do users' perceptions of trust and effectiveness change when using explainable visual analytics interfaces compared to traditional opaque interfaces?
